title.narrative: 006 C4D:PROGRAMME EFFECTIVENESS

description.narrative: 'Mechanisms to deliver quality Communication for Development (C4D) interventions are heightened through increased generation and use of evidence, strengthened capacity of staff and partners, reinforced and expanded strategic partnership and coordination, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New ElementBuilding FOs' capacity

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'Mechanisms to deliver quality C4D interventions are heightened through increased generation and use of evidence, strengthenedcapacity of staff and partners, reinforced and expanded strategic partnership and coordination

description.narrative: UNICEF reached over 36.6 million people on prevention and lifesaving messages for children and women through mass media and community engagement platforms using influencers like community and religious leaders and health extension workers (HEWs). Over 33,241 influencers improved their communication skills through capacity-building support from UNICEF. Additionally, skills of C4D staff and staff from government and partner organizations was enhanced on HCD, Social and Behaviour Change (SBC) in humanitarian programmes and tailored SBC training. With UNICEF’s support the Federal Ministry of Health (FMoH) reached over 60 million people on COVID-19 prevention messages, the COVID-19 vaccination and nOPV2. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:06/01/2022
